page.title: 14TRAFFIC COUNT NEWTON ST. C.
page.content: Our count,on Friday May 24 between 8.30a.m. and 3.30p.m.,showed that{4350 {vehicles}passed through our village. { Over 3000 cars and about 1000 heavy {lorries and vans}were recorded.50 buses/coaches and 50 motorcycles were listed.Only{two cycles}were noted. {An average of more than 600 vehicles {per hour}travelled on the A377 Main road in that period. The highest number of cars recorded was between 8.30 and 9.30a.m. in the Exeter direction.We assume that most of the drivers and passengers were {travelling to work in or around the {city. The number of cyclists shows, perhaps, how dangerous this road is. {Many 'near-misses' are not recorded in Devon County Council's official {accident figures.
